enhanced_by.reason: Both methods involve preparing lists of items for further processing, specifically splitting and pairing.
The split method relies on sorting the list of items, which is similar to the comparator method's role in defining sorting criteria.
The split method evaluates the margin sum of pairs, which is similar to the marginValueSum method's role in calculating the sum of margin values.
The split method evaluates the overlap between pairs, which is similar to the overlap method's role in calculating the overlap area.
